etymologies: mid 19th century: named after Rugby School (see Rugby), where the game was first played

crossReferenceMarkers: See also rugby league and rugby union
definitions: a team game played with an oval ball that may be kicked, carried, and passed from hand to hand. Points are scored by grounding the ball behind the opponents' goal line (thereby scoring a try) or by kicking it between the two posts and over the crossbar of the opponents' goal.
shortDefinitions: team game played with oval ball that may be kicked
